instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This arrived with both CD3217s having burn marks on them from minor liquid on the usb-c connector. Fans were also spinning very fast at the time at only 5V but 1.5amps. No liquid damage on the board itself.

Replaced both CD3217s board now has 20v but only using 0.06 amps. No fan spin now.

<CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7270</CHIP> looked burnt, replaced them as well but no change.

All AWAKE and SLP2R voltages are present but cannot enter DFU mode.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is shorted but nothing gets warm on thermal cam.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.30V

Not sure where to go from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7270</CHIP> looked burnt"
Very likely dead CPU...

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is shorted but nothing gets warm on thermal cam"
What is the exact ohm value?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You should get aprox 1A/5W, when injecting 5V; something should heat on the MLB.
Be sure to set PSU limit to max first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7220</CHIP> showed heat when injecting voltage.

Replaced <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>. Still 0V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> but now is 38ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
38 ohm is still too low; compare with good board.
Dificult to find the culprit with voltage injection now.
Maybe waiting several minutes and trying to detect small difference with IR cam.
